title: Telemetry Registered Nurse - TRN24-12191
description:
**Job Title:** Telemetry Registered Nurse
  

**Location:** Neptune, NJ 07754  

**Duration:** 3 Months


**Job Summary:** The Registered Nurse (RN) specializing in Telemetry is responsible for evaluating patients and assisting physicians with patient care. The RN will plan, implement, and document nursing care based on patient needs, ensuring a patient-centric approach that aligns with professional nursing practices.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Evaluate patients and assist physicians in providing care. Plan, implement, and document nursing care based on patient assessments.
* Identify patient needs and determine priorities for care through assessment, planning, intervention, and evaluation.
* Develop, implement, and coordinate individualized care plans for patients based on initial and ongoing assessments.
* Initiate assessments based on patient needs, physician diagnoses, and the functional health framework.
* Perform therapeutic nursing interventions and manage patient care. Document care according to standards of practice, patient acuity, and clinical priorities.
* Advocate for evidence-based practice care standards and support the adoption of evidence-based practices and innovations in care delivery.
* Provide patient-centric care in alignment with the professional nursing practice model. Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


**Required Skills & Experience:**


* Minimum of 2 years of recent experience in Telemetry nursing.
* Ability to support admitted patients holding in the ED area.


**Education:**


* Required: Associate's Degree in Nursing (ASN). Graduation from an accredited school of nursing.
* Preferred: Bachelor's Degree in Nursing (BSN). Telemetry Certification or Telemetry Competency Exam is required.


**Required Certifications & Licensure:**


* Basic Life Support (BLS) - AHA
* New Jersey State Professional Registered Nurse license or multi-state compact license
* National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
* Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS) - AHA


**Languages:** English (Speak, Read, Write)


**Hours Per Week:** 36.00  

**Hours Per Day:** 12.00  

**Days Per Week:** 3.00


**Schedule Notes:**


* Support admitted patients holding in the ED area.
* Shift: 7:00 PM - 7:30 AM, 3 x 12-hour shifts.
* Every other weekend required, holidays required.
* No on-call requirement.
* Float requirement: Yes, within similar telemetry units within the facility.

title: Mechanical Engineering Intern, Space Systems
description:
Marotta Controls, Inc. is one of NJ’s fastest growing technology companies, named a New Jersey Top Workplace for 2022 & 2023, and a “Made in New Jersey” Manufacturer of the Year Award Winner that specializes in the design, development, and production of precision control components and systems. Founded in 1943, Marotta has been at the forefront of Aerospace & Defense milestones for over 80 years from breaking the sound barrier on the Bell X-1 and landing the first man on the moon to playing a critical role on today’s advanced U.S Navy platforms as well as the emerging commercial pace industry.
Our products and expertise range from high performance valves to complete sub-systems that integrate electronic controls, actuators, and power conversion systems. We have received over 200 patents for our technologies and support the most demanding applications found on military aircraft, tactical systems, submarines, surface ships, satellites and space launch vehicles. Our teams have repeatedly been recognized for outstanding performance by some of the most prestigious organizations in the world including The Boeing Company, Lockheed Martin, NASA & Northrop Grumman.  


**Mechanical Engineering Intern (Summer 2025)**  


**Responsibilities:**
* Design and analyze novel aerospace control components.
* Write assembly procedures, special processes, test reports, and other technical documents.
* Search for sources of supply of components and special process vendors.
* Support design and validation of fixtures for assembly and test operations.
* Product specification review and compliance analysis.
* Create training documents with verification tests.
* Review and create Engineering drawings with a focus on tolerance stack-ups, design feasibility, product improvement, and compliance with specifications.
* Participate in selected Design Reviews to help present design parameters.
* Perform basic trigonometry and solid geometry calculations, when needed.
* Work with other engineers in a team environment.

  

**Required Qualifications:**
* Excellent mechanical aptitude.
* Strong interest in Aerospace design.
* Proficient in 3D CAD. Pro-E preferred.
* Excellent grades, especially in core engineering courses.
* Must work precisely, accurately, and with close attention to all details.
* High level of system aptitude and knowledge.
* Advanced organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Must be a US Citizen


**Education:**
* High school thru post graduate degree students are encouraged to apply – Mechanical, Aerospace, Materials Engineering, or equivalent.


**Work Environment:**
* This job interacts both in a professional office environment and a manufacturing/machine shop environment. This role uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines, as well as environments inclusive of the appropriate eye, hearing and foot protection (as required).


**Physical Requirements:**
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to see, talk and hear.
* The Engineering Intern is frequently required to reach with hands and arms, and to use hands to finger, handle or feel
* The Engineering Intern is frequently required to sit at length, stand, walk, and move about the facility.
* The Engineering Intern may be required to lift and/or move items weighing up to 20 pounds


Position location Montville or Parsippany, NJ TBD  



Many of our contracts require proof that you are a U.S. citizen and/or that an export license has been obtained for employees who are citizens of certain countries. Your employment, both initially and continually thereafter, is conditioned on the production of such proof of citizenship and/or any export license that may be required to comply with any and all applicable laws, regulations, or executive orders, or required by Federal, State, or local government contracts.
Please visit our website at www.marotta.com to learn more about us and to apply. Check out all our openings at https://marotta.com/job-openings/

We are an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity employer M/F/IWD/Veterans
VETERANS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY
**No agencies, please.**
company_description: Marotta Controls, Inc. specializes in the design, development, and production of precision control components and systems.

title: Mover / Laborer
description:
**NOW HIRING GREAT PEOPLE!** We believe in: hire for attitude, train for skill. **TWO MEN AND A TRUCK®** is hiring immediately and looking for multiple movers and drivers to join our team. Experience in general labor, construction, warehouse labor, landscaping, moving, or delivery driving helpful! **We will set up an interview ASAP around your schedule!**
* **Must be willing to submit to pre-employment drug screen and background check**
* **Valid driver's license required to be a driver (non-CDL)**
**What We Offer**
-----------------


* **Pay range: $15 - $19 per hour**
* Full-time, part-time, and seasonal work available
* Earn tips from customers - top performers average $200 per week
* Work hard and get a raise every 6 months!
* Overtime opportunities available
* Benefits: medical, 401(k) and paid time off
* Weekly paychecks with direct deposit
* Hands-on training and career development
* Employee recognition programs with bonuses and incentives

**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Provide top notch customer service as you safely move, pack and unpack customer belongings
* Greet customer upon arrival to location, make a positive first impression (smile, handshake, positive attitude), and complete a walk-through of the premises
* Communicate professionally in English, both verbally and in writing
* As the team leader, drivers are responsible for safely maneuvering a 26’ box truck
* Movers will assist drivers with truck inspections and moving equipment inventory
* Accurately complete paperwork and payment collection
* Experience in customer service, general labor, landscaping, military training, construction, operations, fleet or warehouse helpful!

**Requirements**
----------------


* High school diploma or equivalent
* Mover, driver, general labor or warehouse experience helpful!
* Excellent customer service skills
* Professional attitude and demeanor
* Willingness to learn
* Stamina to lift heavy items (100 lbs. or more) repeatedly while climbing, balancing, kneeling, crouching, walking, etc.
* Valid driver's license and good driving record required to be a driver
* Must be willing to submit to pre-employment background check and drug screen


This job posting is for a position at the individually owned and operated **TWO MEN AND A TRUCK**® franchise located in Livingston, New Jersey. The employer at this location is TMT NJ Orange, LLC.
company_description: At TWO MEN AND A TRUCK® our core purpose is to move people forward. We move people personally and professionally.
